data.meta_site_name: Lottie Williams Obituary | February 27, 2019 | McKoy & Sons Mortuary - Saint Pauls, NC
data.text:
Mrs. Lottie Mae Williams 73, passed February 27, 2019. Funeral services will be Wednesday, March 6, 2019 at 2:00 pm from the Pleasant Grove Missionary Baptist Church, 2917 E. Great Marsh Church Rd., St. Pauls, NC, Reverend Amanda Pone, Officiating. Visitation: Tuesday, March 5, 2019 at 1-8 pm. Burial: Shiloh Cemetery, St. Pauls, NC. The family will receive family and friends at 277 Coy Rd., St. Pauls, NC.

Mrs. Lottie Mae "Lottie Dottie" Williams, daughter of the late Lloyd White, Sr and Jesse Bell Robinson. Mrs. Williams was born on January 6, 1946. She departed her life on February 27, 2019 at Southeastern Regional Medical Center in Lumberton, NC.

Mrs. Williams was employed at Scothurst Golf Course for a while. She was a very hard and dedicated worker at work and at home, until her health failed.

Mrs. Williams excepted Christ and join Pleasant Grove Missionary Baptist Church. She was a loving wife, mother, grandmother, sister, aunt, niece, cousin and friend.

Mrs. Williams is proceded in death by her father; Lloyd White, Sr., her mother; Jesse Bell Robinson, her husband; Henry D. Williams, one son; David Lee Williams and three grandsons; Jimmy Lee Hunt Williams, Willie James Stanford, Jr. and James Antonio Williams and one granddaughter; Starlite Williams.

She leaves to Cherish her memory, nine children; Margie D. Williams of St. Pauls, NC, Rosie A. Love (June) of Raeford, NC, Jerry L. Williams (Sharon) of Montana, Mary L. Williams of St. Pauls, NC, James I. Williams (Heather) of Hope Mills, NC, David T. Williams of St. Pauls, NC, Monica M. Aguirre (David) of Lumberton, NC, Angela M. McLeod (Jermaine) of Hope Mills, NC and Crystal R. Williams of St. Pauls, NC, 18 grandchildren; 17 great grandchildren and 2 great great grandchildren, 1 brother; Walter White of New York, 11 sisters; Annie Patterson of Hope Mills, NC, Leona Lathan of Fayetteville, NC, Essie Hines of Raeford, NC, Geneva Cheruvin of New York, Mary Allman of Tar Heel, NC, Dorothy Easter of Tar Heel, NC, Lula Whitley of Tar Heel, NC, Mildred Benson of Virginia, Linda Coe of Parkton, NC, Vickie Jones of Fayetteville, NC and Dixie Lock of Parkton, NC, 5 sister-in-laws; Lucy Stephens of Parkton, NC, Dorothy Stephens of St. Pauls, NC, Mary A. Williams of Rex, NC, Betty Sue Williams, Rex, NC and Corine Shaw of Rex, NC and a host of nieces, nephews, aunts, uncles, cousins and friends.
